comment: She is rude to her students. She does not have a caring attitude and is condescending to anyone who has a concern or problem. She gives ambiguous feedback on essays. She waited 5 days after the semester was over at Christmas Break to email me on my school email to say she could not open my final essay and I had 4 hours to resubmit or it was a zero.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: She is very passive aggressive towards everyone. The lectures are way to long and super boring. The assignments are pretty easy and its easy to pass the class she just makes the class uncomfortable. She calls on random people when no one raises their hands and often picks on kids who are quieter and don't often raise their hands.

Overall, the class is cake if you do your work, and extra credit opportunities are given. Try to attend every class, as missing one may lead to some distaste and animosity from the professor, which could affect your grade. The lectures can be boring and awkward.

I don't suggest taking a class taught by Professor Vahal. Her work instructions are confusing and she doesn't give specifics within the 3 big assignments. Me and a few others have stated that her passive aggressiveness downplays our confidence in our ability to complete our work. I understand that she is here to help, but her way is very unhealthy.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Even in a small class it seem very hard to connect with her. She is very rude and catty, when it comes to answering questions or correcting you. It seem like she get something out of you being wrong. Not understanding at all, really wouldn't recommended. Makes environmental uncomfortable to work and learn in
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: I would avoid her class if possible. Content-wise its pretty average but can get very repetitive over time, its mostly powerpoints and useless readings. Her rubrics and guidelines for essays are not the most clear, and don't bother asking about it either because she'll be very passive agressive and talk down to you if you ask.

Avoid at all costs!!!!!!!!!!!! If she does not like you personally she will grade you towards that. Not only are her instructions unclear and confusing, and she treats her students like they are dumb, or slow if they ask clarification questions. Favoritism is clear and takes attendance THE MINUTE it is time for class, so DO NOT be late. Good Luck.

Vahal will give unnecessary readings that you might have already learned. If you aren't in class often, she will gain a distaste for you. She does not understand that college can become overwhelming for students. Her tone when speaking to you can be condescending and it makes you uncomfortable to want to speak. Would not take her class again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: She's very adamant on what she wants. She wastes lots of time just to fill in the lecture time, and she gives way too many readings. She also says you NEED to do the readings when in reality they are useless 90% of the time. The class is so repetitive, and it could easily have been an online course instead of wasting my time in these lectures.

Discussion board posts count for a higher percentage than actual quizzes & are difficult to keep track of. No reminder in weekly modules, checklists, or upcoming scheduled events. You will have to remember to go into the syllabus to check each week and some of these discussions are 6 weeks apart from each other. Keep track of your extra credit!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Very small class size with a very long runtime leads to a good amount of 1 on one time with this professor. She spends class time making weird examples out of the 5 students in her class and overall just being demeaning and nasty. She will follow this up by trying to convince you to visit the comic shop she works at fri-wed. Easy but tedious work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy
